definitions.definition: To impair the soundness, goodness, or value of; to harm or cause destruction .
examples: Be careful not to damage any of the fragile items while unpacking them.
Cold temperatures, heavy rain, falling rocks, strong winds and glacier movement can damage the equipment.

definitions.definition: To undergo damage; to take damage.
To remove a damaged or unsalable item from the sales floor for processing.
examples: Did you damage the items that the customer returned yet?

main_definition: ( transitive ) To impair the soundness, goodness, or value of; to harm or cause destruction .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To undergo damage; to take damage.
( transitive ) To remove a damaged or unsalable item from the sales floor for processing.
